com.northconcepts.datapipeline.core

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.northconcepts.datapipeline.core.Functions

  • public final class Functions
extends Object
    Functions is the entry point for adding new method aliases to the dynamic expression language. An alias is a short name used to reference a fully-qualified, public, static method (for example abs() instead of java.lang.Math.abs()).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void add(Class<?> clazz, String methodName1, String... methodNames)
      Creates aliases for one or more public, static methods on the specified class using their simple names (for example java.lang.Math.abs() will be aliased as abs).
      static void add(String alias, Class<?> clazz, String methodName)
      Creates a new alias for a public, static method on the specified class.
      static void add(String alias, String signature)
      Creates a new alias for a fully-qualified, public, static method.
      static void addAll(Class<?> clazz, boolean includeSuperclasses, String... methodNames)
      Creates aliases either for all public, static methods on the specified class and superclass using their simple names (for example java.lang.Math.abs() will be aliased as abs) or just the specified methods.
      static String get(String alias)
      Returns the fully-qualified method name for a function alias or null.
      static String[] getAliases()
      Returns all the aliases.
      static int getCount()
      Returns the number of aliased functions.
      static void reset(boolean clear)
      Re-add all the built-in function aliases, optionally clearing the registry first.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public static void add(String alias,
                       String signature)
        Creates a new alias for a fully-qualified, public, static method.
        Parameters:
        alias - the short name used in expressions.
        signature - the fully-qualified, public, static method.

      • add

        public static void add(String alias,
                       Class<?> clazz,
                       String methodName)
        Creates a new alias for a public, static method on the specified class.
        Parameters:
        alias - the short name used in expressions.
        clazz - the class to search for methodName.
        methodName - the public, static method name (not fully-qualified, doesn't include the class or package names).

      • add

        public static void add(Class<?> clazz,
                       String methodName1,
                       String... methodNames)
        Creates aliases for one or more public, static methods on the specified class using their simple names (for example java.lang.Math.abs() will be aliased as abs).
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to search for method names.
        methodName1 - the first public, static method name (not fully-qualified, doesn't include the class or package names).
        methodNames - subsequent public, static method name (not fully-qualified, doesn't include the class or package names).

      • addAll

        public static void addAll(Class<?> clazz,
                          boolean includeSuperclasses,
                          String... methodNames)
        Creates aliases either for all public, static methods on the specified class and superclass using their simple names (for example java.lang.Math.abs() will be aliased as abs) or just the specified methods.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to search for method names.
        includeSuperclasses - indicates if public, static methods on super classes should be included.
        methodNames - the specified public, static methods to add or all if none are specified.

      • get

        public static String get(String alias)
        Returns the fully-qualified method name for a function alias or null.

      • getCount

        public static int getCount()
        Returns the number of aliased functions.

      • getAliases

        public static String[] getAliases()
        Returns all the aliases.

      • reset

        public static void reset(boolean clear)
        Re-add all the built-in function aliases, optionally clearing the registry first.
